pull.title: refactor: Move m_num_unconnecting_headers_msgs out of cs_main guard
pull.body: The variable does not need to be guarded by cs_main, so move it out of the cs_main scope. It is not used for validation-specific state, but only for headers-processing internal state and logging.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#26140](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26140) (refactor: Move CNodeState members guarded by g_msgproc_mutex to Peer by dergoegge)
* [#24571](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24571) (p2p: Prevent block index fingerprinting by sending additional getheaders messages by dergoegge)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2221,28 +2222,26 @@ void PeerManagerImpl::SendBlockTransactions(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const CBlo
  *
  * We'll send a getheaders message in response to try to connect the chain.
  *
- * The peer can send up to MAX_UNCONNECTING_HEADERS in a row that
+ * The peer can send up to MAX_UNCONNECTING_HEADERS_MSGS in a row that
comments.body: Care to address [this comment ](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25454/files/99f4785cad94657dcf349d00fdd6f1d44cac9bb0#r912929185) while you're touching this line?
Should this be named `m_num_unconnecting_headers_msgs` for consistency with the style guide?

`Peer` is a `struct`, so it shouldn't use `m_` prefixes. To quote the style guide:

> Class member variables have a m_ prefix.

For rationale, see for example https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19759

(So in theory https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25557 could drop the `m_` prefix)

Though, I don't care about the style guide too much, so I am happy to change this to make reviewers happy and I am also not going to comment on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25557 to suggest a change.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2221,28 +2222,26 @@ void PeerManagerImpl::SendBlockTransactions(CNode& pfrom, Peer& peer, const CBlo
  *
  * We'll send a getheaders message in response to try to connect the chain.
  *
- * The peer can send up to MAX_UNCONNECTING_HEADERS in a row that
+ * The peer can send up to MAX_UNCONNECTING_HEADERS_MSGS in a row that

comments.body: Thanks for pointing me to that (and now I'm kicking myself for all those `m_`'s!)
